wikipedia_page.main: Albert Arthur "Alf" Purcell (3 November 1872, Hoxton – 24 December 1935) was a British trade unionist and Labour Party politician. He was a founding member of the Communist Party of Great Britain and later  President of the International Federation of Trade Unions from 1924 to 1928  and sat in the House of Commons during two separate periods between 1923 and 1929.
